title: Related rates with volume of cone

content.question: A container has the shape of an open right circular cone, as shown in the figure above. The container has a radius of 4 feet at the top, and its height is 12 feet. If water flows into the container at a constant rate of 6 cubic feet per minute, how fast is the water level rising when the height of the water is 5 feet? (The volume V of a cone with radius r and height h is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>V</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> <mi>Ï€</mi> <msup> <mi>r</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mi>h</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4176@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.)

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
